title: Baidu, ASML, furniture stocks rise; Outlook Therapeutics sinks
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. futures are trading higher with Nasdaq 100 Futures futures up as much as 1.1% in pre-market Friday. ASML (NASDAQ:ASML) are up 4.9% after Aletheia Capital double-upgraded the European-listed shares of the chip equipment maker to buy from sell. The brokerage firm cited investment expansion plans and capacity upgrades as key drivers behind its more constructive view. title: U.S. futures rise as markets kick off new year on upbeat note
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. stock futures are pointing higher at the start of the new year, setting markets up to snap a four-day losing streak as investors return to themes that powered gains through much of 2025. S&P 500 Futures were up about 0.6% at 6:40 AM ET (11:40 GMT) in New York, while Nasdaq 100 Futures contracts climbed 1.1%. Dow Jones Industrial Average futures added 0.4%. title: Stocks Set to Rise With Focus on Silver, Tech and Furniture
summary: Precious metals continued to be volatile as silver prices rose again.  S&P 500 futures were gaining 0.6% and Nasdaq 100 futures were rising 1%.  Tech stocks may be getting a boost from sentiment in China after Baidu's artificial-intelligence chip unit filed for a Hong Kong IPO.

title: 2 Nasdaq 100 Stocks with Solid Fundamentals and 1 We Turn Down
summary: The Nasdaq 100 (^NDX) is known for housing some of the most innovative and fastest-growing companies in the market. But not every stock in the index is a winner - some are struggling with slowing growth, increasing competition, or unsustainable valuations.

title: Nasdaq Drops for Fourth Straight Session
summary: The Nasdaq Composite could end the year on its longest losing streak since April. The tech-heavy index was down 0.2% on Wednesday. It's on track for a fourth daily decline in a row, which hasn't happened since April 21, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

title: Stocks Set for Losses in Weak End to Strong Year; Silver Tumbles
summary: U.S. stock futures were pointing to a negative opening for the final trading day of 2025, although the small moves are unlikely to take the shine off another strong year overall.  S&P 500 futures were falling 0.2% and Nasdaq 100 futures were dropping 0.4%.  The moves look like a continuation of the muted sentiment on show during the so-called Santa Claus rally period – comprising the final five trading sessions of the year and the first two of the new year.

title: ‘You Had to Be Brave’: Wall Street Remembers a Wild 2025
summary: It was the evening of Wednesday, April 2, and President Donald Trump had just appeared in the White House Rose Garden, brandishing a large placard with the punitive tariff rates he was slapping on countries around the world.  On Wall Street, it quickly sunk in that Trump was serious about shattering a global trading system that he said was wired against the US.  Over dinner with his family and throughout the night — as Asian markets tumbled, initiating a meltdown that would continue around the globe — Ellerbroek, a portfolio manager at Argent Capital Management, tried to game out what would happen next.

title: S&P Futures Tread Water Ahead of FOMC Meeting Minutes
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are trending down -0.02% this morning as investors adopt a cautious stance ahead of the release of the Federal Reserve’s December meeting minutes.
